definition: posthumous name or title/to confer a posthumous title
ordinal number/day of a month/mark/sign/business establishment/size/ship suffix/horn (wind instrument)/bugle call/assumed name/to take a pulse/classifier used to indicate number of people
temple name of a deceased Chinese emperor
posthumous name or title/to confer a posthumous title
to give to the departed/to confer (a title) posthumously
honorific title/form of address reserved for a queen, ancestor, emperor etc
to seal up (a door with a paper seal, or a document)/to confer an additional title on a nobleman
to succeed to a title/to inherit
tutor to the crown prince (in imperial China)
to hand down an imperial edict
honorific title during Tang to Qing times, approx. "Glorious grand master"
